intro: Mesembryanthemum intrusum, commonly known as the intruding mesem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in spring and summer. Mesembryanthemum intrusum is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that is popular in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
